poem:
### Top 40 Universe

Saxophone whispers through  
childhood airwaves,  
a careless echo  
of mornings stacked  
on a chart's brim.  
George gilds the room,  
instincts spinning—  
unnoticed galaxies  
in radio orbit.  

Spice trails lead to  
storefront altars;  
what we gather  
between notes  
counts for centuries.
